column5: Algonquin lakes are still frozen so I would guess most everything north of that is also still frozen.
i figured it was still frozen, my question should have been more like how much ice is there still. hahah
I wonder what the ice fishing will be like in July up there!
HARD ! Neighbour on Island across from ours... still sledding to town !
Assuming ice is still on the lake, are you of the opinion it will be gone by next weekend? Really cutting it close to the anual fishing trip.
from the satellite pics today, Temagami is wide open and ice free
Nice to see some of the ice (finally) fade away. For those looking for a good ice out opportunity, pike fishing is open year round in section 17! (Please stay away from primary muskie lakes!)
Hasn't been ice on the southern shore of Lake O for a while....  Now let's just get that water heated up a bit for spring kings!
anyone been on the Highway 35 corridor between Minden & Dorset? wondered if there's any progress on the ice out there...

Just got a report from the Algonquin Park area from the weekend . Opeongo still has 15-18" of ice and all ponds and streams in area were still locked up, as well the park is expecting 10-20 cm of snow this week . Any interior trips planned for Algonquin come the opener at this point will probably be in jeopardy   Locals in the area are still calling for a first week of May ice out . No reports from the Parry Sound - Dunchurch area but should have something in the next couple days ! One positive out of this is no blackflies for the May long weekend
Lots of open water in the farmers' fields today----can't vouch for the fishing, though.
Penetang Harbour is just about ice free. Midland Harbour is totally black, all it needs is a good wind and the ice is gone.
With 35K winds Thursday and Friday you should be alright.
May 1st is opener.. have a birthday boy we need to get out there that day. Issue might be... we can't get boats in as the water is still 3 feet below datum !
Just amagine what you could do Wayne,if you had a helicopter.. LOL
90% of the ice came off Pinehurst today,  thats usually the sign for open water at most locations.
Who is ready?
The boat is going in this weekend!!  Team 1 needs a big fat carp!
on Tuesday we were still drilling ice to the engine of the power augers up in the Wawa area...gonna be a while still
Curious if anyone can provide  Minden Haliburton updates?

Just received an update on Algonquin Park ice conditions today and they are reporting that Opeongo and surrounding lakes still have 10-18" of ice and is still locked to shore . Bigger rivers have opened up but the smaller ones are still frozen . The guys that run the water taxi on Opeongo say "not a chance" will the ice be gone come opener ,still calling for ice out in the first week of May. No reports from any where else yet but when I hear anything I will post .
Still 3 feet of ice under my hut, 3-4 feet of snow in the bush, 20-30cm today and tomorrow!! Gotta love the north!! Just insane,,,,,,,insane....
The top of Kempenfelt Bay was open today from the southshore centre as far as I could see. With the normal west winds the ice will be done near the launches maybe in time for this weekend.
This is for the park... http://algonquinpark.on.ca/news/ice-out.php

We are right on the edge. Most lakes - except where there is good current - are still ice covered, but very dark. I went to check Koshlong yesterday, and it was just coming off the banks.  If we get 2 days of good winds, it will start to break up fast. We have 3 days of 30 Km/h forecasted.
The Tiffen launch needs a few more day of warm weather.  But she's close!
Thanks sd, this is something i can get exited about!
me too!...Please let us know how those winds do!

Parry Sound - Dunchurch area lakes are still ice covered and locked to shore except for current areas that have opened up in the last week . Reports of 6-10" of ice on area lakes . Algonquin , well all I can say is forget the opener . Opeongo and surrounding lakes are still being reported with  10-14" of ice as well add all the washout problems in the park
Anyone know what Temagami is looking like now?
what about the timmins area, i have a trip to horwood lake first week of june and a bit curious

Was out driving around... starting to see some open water forming... About 1 foot of open water at the public launch in Port Perry on the weekend. The trent by 12 is open water, not sure how far that extends towards the lake.  The harbour area of the bridge between cooch and simcoe is open water about 500 yards on either side of the causeway... Not much else to report on...Looks like a cold month at night still, the speckle lake might still be frozen for the opener.
Getting nervous, 4 day trip to the park for opener and not much activity up there right now
Still driving on the lake in Temagami.. will be for a while yet....
Looking out the window at Clear Lake in the K's, it all still looks pretty hard to me.

I live on Shebeshekong lake north of Parry Sound and was out ice fishing on the weekend and we still have 30 inches of ice it will be a while yet as they are calling for cold tempuratures at night last year ice was out after the first week of April.  Cheers Mitch...
Dang we have had open water for a month in lsc just waiting for them eyes to get out to the lake here.
That's going to be tight.  If there is no ice that water is going to be so cold you'd probably have better luck ice fishing!
That makes me want to drive up and get out on the ice one last time
Lots of boats out on lake O and long point bay....not sure about the catching part...
Lots of open water down here, i dont think theres any ice left after the weekend, lovin it!
Think I should move it by a week? I just want to get there before anyone else fishes it this year...
I just checked out the algonquin page, never realized they had an ice-out watch too!  http://www.algonquinpark.on.ca/news/ice-out.php  cheers,  S&C
We have bumped our trout opener for the park by a week. two years ago the speckle lake we fish was still partly covered with ice and we got skunked.
A week will only help the fishing. First to fish it?? That will depend on other things as well including condition of the road into the access point.
If anyone could let me know when little lake or rice lake open up I would really apreciate it. Crappie, you have eluded me long enough!
Georgian Bay is open as far as the eye can see!!

I am hearing from a couple of guys in the north country (central Ontario) that there is still 15-25 inches of ice on the lakes up there and a some Algonquin regulars have pushed there trips back to the beginning of May and they are telling me that they are expecting ice out around May 1st . I think all lakes north of hwy 60 and even some south in Algonquin will be ice covered come the opener as well from past experience you need the water to warm up a bit and get the whole lake ecosystem moving again for optimal trout fishing (1-3 weeks after ice out is the best) If you time it right due to late ice out , this spring could be a good one If I here of any more conditions in the next couple weeks I will let you guys know . If I was you CK I would be pushing your trip back a week !

Yup, we pushe our trout trip ahead 2 weeks this year. Its always nice to be first on the lake, but not very often does it mean the best fishing.  The best spring troutin is when the bugs are just starting to bite.
Not that it matters to Anyone...  But Orr Lake is still locked up...

I had to make a dump run about an hour ago and noticed most creeks are running free including Nogies...the bays are still frozen and look pretty solid...methinks Cliff is right...about another two weeks...  The big river in town never did freeze over this winter but the ice was gone from Pigeon by the end of March last year...
Is there anyone in the k/w area that knows what the ponds around there are like? Thinking of trying out a carp spot tomorrow...

Driving around today Chris Pm me with which specific pond and I 'll look for you. Everything is still all iced up minus temps and lots of snow today didn't help. North sides of Bannister and Wrigley are starting to open up.
we still have around forty inches of ice beside my house, so our ice out may be the second week in may (if we are lucky)
satalite picture shows the bottom of Cooks Bay open.  Rest of Simcoe still locked up  Quinte is open

Lake Erie is ice free until you get to ice booms in Buffalo and that includes the inner bay of Long Point, the Grand River is free of ice as well from the Caledonia Dam to Port Maitland. All ice gone on the Niagara peninsula including Hamilton Harbor.
